alternative_parents.description: Compounds comprising the primary alcohol functional group, with the general structure RCOH (R=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Primary alcohols

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a chemical bond between a carbon atom and a chlorine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organochlorides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the alkyl chloride functional group with formula R-Cl , where R is an alkyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Alkyl chlorides

class.description: Alcohols substituted by a halogen atom at a saturated carbon atom otherwise bearing only hydrogen or hydrocarbyl groups (usually used to mean beta-halo alcohols).
class.name: Halohydrins

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as chlorohydrins. These are alcohols substituted by a chlorine atom at a saturated carbon atom otherwise bearing only hydrogen or hydrocarbyl groups.

direct_parent.description: Alcohols substituted by a chlorine atom at a saturated carbon atom otherwise bearing only hydrogen or hydrocarbyl groups.
direct_parent.name: Chlorohydrins

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Alcohols substituted by a chlorine atom at a saturated carbon atom otherwise bearing only hydrogen or hydrocarbyl groups.
subclass.name: Chlorohydrins

superclass.description: Organic compounds containing a bond between a carbon atom and a halogen atom (At, F, Cl, Br, I).
superclass.name: Organohalogen compounds
